recipe.title: Lemon Tart
recipe.description: Tangy, smooth lemon curd in a buttery pastry shell

steps.descr: Roll out pastry and line a tart tin, chill 30 mins
steps.instructions: Roll out pastry and line a tart tin, chill 30 mins

on_enter.say: Let's roll out the pastry and line our tart tin. Then we'll pop it in the fridge to chill for thirty minutes. This helps it hold its shape beautifully.

Right, let's blind bake our pastry. Preheat your oven to one hundred eighty degrees celsius, that's about three hundred fifty degrees fahrenheit, and bake for twenty minutes. You'll know it's ready when it's lightly golden.

steps.descr: Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice
steps.instructions: Whisk eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest and juice

on_enter.say: Now let's whisk together the eggs, yolks, sugar, lemon zest, and juice. You want it to be smooth and well combined. It'll smell wonderfully citrusy!
Let's gently stir in the double cream until everything is beautifully mixed. This will make our filling nice and rich.
Now, pour that lovely lemon mixture into the pastry case. Make sure it's evenly spread out.

steps.descr: Bake at 140°C for 35-40 minutes until just set
steps.instructions: Bake at 140°C for 35-40 minutes until just set

on_enter.say: Time to bake our tart. Set your oven to one hundred forty degrees celsius, or two hundred eighty-four degrees fahrenheit, and bake for thirty-five to forty minutes. It should be just set with a slight wobble in the middle.

steps.descr: Cool completely, dust with icing sugar
steps.instructions: Cool completely, dust with icing sugar

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Let the tart cool completely before dusting with a bit of icing sugar. It'll look and taste absolutely gorgeous. Well done!

notes.text:
The filling should have a slight wobble
Best served chilled
Use unwaxed lemons for the zest
